title.native: 現実主義勇者の王国再建記
title.romaji: Genjitsu Shugi Yuusha no Oukoku Saikenki
title.english: How a Realist Hero Rebuilt the Kingdom

description:
Suddenly summoned to a fantasy world and betrothed to the princess, Kazuya Souma is crowned the new king after providing the royal family with impressive advice. To rule the kingdom, he's taking the nontraditional (and very human) route of administrative reform. In a realm of dragons and elves, will this revolutionary's unique path prove effective?

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: ยุทธศาสตร์กู้ชาติของราชามือใหม่

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Kingdom Management
tags.description: Characters in these series take on the responsibility of running a town or kingdom, whether they take control of an existing one, or build their own from the ground up.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Economics
tags.description: Centers around the field of economics.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Royal Affairs
tags.description: Features nobility, alliances, arranged marriage, succession disputes, religious orders and other elements of royal politics.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Classic Literature
tags.description: Discusses or adapts a work of classic world literature.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Cosplay
tags.description: Features dressing up as a different character or profession.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TkashiWatanabe)

Joined Top Craft as an animator while still attending university, switched his focus to directing in the late '80s.

Married to [Miyata Naomi](https://anilist.co/staff/220081/).

[Website](https://highkick.jp/tateyama)

He is a drummer for the Japanese rock band THE LINDA!, which was formed in 2002 when its members were enrolled at Rikkyo University.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大塚舞)

Originating from [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/). Currently freelance.

Aspired to become an animator after having seen [Densetsu no Yuusha Da Garn](https://anilist.co/anime/2803/).

__Height:__ 154 cm 
__Agency:__ AXL-ONE

__[Website](https://inoriminase.com)__ | __[Profile (AXL-ONE)](http://axl-one.com/talent/minase.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inoriminase)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/inoriminase_info/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYBwKaLwCGY7k3auR_FLanA)__

A Japanese voice actress and singer-songwriter under entertainment agency Axlone (2017–) and record label King Records (2015–), having previously been under entertainment agency Sony Music Entertainment (2010–2017). She has been active as a voice actor since 2010, debuting in the anime Occult Academy voicing the character Akari Okamoto, while debuting as a singer-songwriter in December 2015.

Inori was born in Tokyo, where she began watching anime in kindergarten. She first became aware of voice acting when, after watching a stage play adaption of an anime, she read the stage pamphlet and asked her parents about a person mentioned in it. She found out that she wanted to become a voice actor at the age of six, and at elementary school she listed voice acting as her desired future career. 

In middle school, Inori joined her school's tennis and theater clubs, however, she quit the theater club due to feeling too embarrassed when appearing on stage. Around the same time, her mother found a magazine advertising for a voice-acting audition, which she participated in and won.

(Source: Wikipedia, edited)

**Non-anime roles:**
- Iris - Memento Mori (VG)
- Soline - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Furina - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Balloon Party - Reverse: 1999 (VG)

**Birthplace:** Niigata City, Niigata Prefecture, Japan
**Major:** National History

**[Website](http://www.yuhoiwasato.com/)**

**Iwasato Yuuho** is a Japanese lyricist and essayist (and former singer-songwriter), who is well-known for writing the lyrics to many anime theme songs. She graduated from Chuo University Faculty of Letters, Department of History, majoring in national history.

__[Blog (JP)](http://ameblo.jp/sira10/)__

__Birthplace:__ Toride City, Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan

__Yuusuke Shirato__ is a Japanese arranger, composer, lyricist and musician.

__[Blog (JP)](http://ameblo.jp/sira10/)__

__Birthplace:__ Toride City, Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan

__Yuusuke Shirato__ is a Japanese arranger, composer, lyricist and musician.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimi_sound) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimin_official/)

A voice actor and musician, notably the lead vocalist and guitarist of [Poppin'Party](https://anilist.co/staff/153185/PoppinParty). Aimi had dreamed of becoming a singer ever since she was young. She initially only aspired to become a singer, but she became interested in voice acting after becoming familiar with the anime series Macross Frontier, where she was impressed at how the series was able to combine music and animation in its storytelling. 

In order to make her dream come true, she participated in various contests, such as the “Best of Singer Contest National Championship 2008”, which she made into the Finals but lost. She was one of 3rd ANIMAX Anison Grand Prix Finalists with Sayaka Sasaki in 2009, and was a winner of the Osaka block. On February 6th, 2010, she made it to the finals of the “Aim for Ellie! Milky Holmes Seiyuu Audition”, a seiyuu audition tour hosted by DWANGO Creative School, but lost the role to Mikoi Sasaki. However, she did make her debut as a seiyuu in the Milky Holmes anime.

Aimi was the guitarist of a girls' band in high school and self-taught, but quit playing after graduating. She picked it up back in 2014 and used it to perform during her THE iDOLM@STER Million Live! live performances as Julia. Aimi is the influence and where Kidani Takaaki, the president of Bushiroad, got his idea for the BanG Dream! franchise from - after seeing Aimi playing the guitar during THE IDOLM@STER M@STERS OF IDOL WORLD!! 2014. 

She used her full name for her voice actress career and Aimi (愛美) for her singer career, but she started to use the latter for both since December 2013.

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia)

**Non-Anime Roles**:
- Brünhilde - Azur Lane (VG)
- Mica - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Serval - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Yan - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Cristallo - Reverse: 1999 (VG)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/barreltaltor) | [Tumblr](https://barreltaltor.tumblr.com/)__

__Birthplace:__ Nagano Prefecture, Japan
__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

__TarutoP__, alternatively known as Taruto, is a Japanese composer, sound engineer and audio mixer. They are affiliated with doujin circle Erekido and musical duo ITOWOKASHI.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/barreltaltor) | [Tumblr](https://barreltaltor.tumblr.com/)__

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

__TarutoP__, alternatively known as Taruto, is a Japanese composer, sound engineer and audio mixer. They are affiliated with doujin circle Erekido and musical duo ITOWOKASHI.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/barreltaltor) | [Tumblr](https://barreltaltor.tumblr.com/)__

__Birthplace:__ Nagano Prefecture, Japan
__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

__TarutoP__, alternatively known as Taruto, is a Japanese composer, sound engineer and audio mixer. They are affiliated with doujin circle Erekido and musical duo ITOWOKASHI.

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TkashiWatanabe)

Joined Top Craft as an animator while still attending university, switched his focus to directing in the late '80s.

Married to [Miyata Naomi](https://anilist.co/staff/220081/).
